content:
• Tuesday, September 20, 2011
  • ORCL

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) is now up 3.5% AH after the company guides for FQ2 revenue of $8.99B-$9.34B...

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) is now up 3.5% AH after the company guides for FQ2 revenue of $8.99B-$9.34B and EPS of $0.56-$0.58, compared with a consensus of $9.36B and $0.56. Oracle expects its struggling hardware business to be flat to down 5%, and claims the weakness is solely due to poor low-end server sales. But IBM might beg to differ.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • ALOG

    Analogic (NASDAQ:ALOG), a maker of medical imaging, ultrasound, and aviation security systems,...

    Analogic (NASDAQ:ALOG), a maker of medical imaging, ultrasound, and aviation security systems, rises 9.2% AH after reporting FQ4 revenue of $135.8M (+18% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.83, beating consensus by $18.8M and $0.43. Growth was driven by a 22% Y/Y increase in medical imaging sales, which accounted for 66% of revenue. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • ADBE

    More on Adobe's (NASDAQ:ADBE) FQ3: Deferred revenue grew by $2M to $484M. Subscription revenue...

    More on Adobe's (NASDAQ:ADBE) FQ3: Deferred revenue grew by $2M to $484M. Subscription revenue was 14% of total sales. 3.6M shares repurchased during quarter. Company expects FQ4 revenue of $1.075B-$1.125B, above $1.07B consensus. FQ4 EPS is expected to be in range of $0.57-$0.64, compared with $0.59 consensus. ADBE +7.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • OREX

    Orexigen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OREX) shares resume trading +60% at $2.34.

    Orexigen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OREX) shares resume trading +60% at $2.34.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • ORCL

    More on Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) FQ1: New software license sales +17% Y/Y. Software update and...

    More on Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) FQ1: New software license sales +17% Y/Y. Software update and support revenue +16%. Hardware revenue -3.5% Y/Y, though 10%+ growth is claimed for the company's high-end server business, and its hardware gross margin rose 6% Q/Q. Free cash flow was $5.3B, up from $3.7B in FQ1 2011. ORCL +0.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • OREX

    Orexigen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OREX) shares are currently halted following the announcement that...

    Orexigen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OREX) shares are currently halted following the announcement that its meeting with senior FDA officials culminated with a written correspondence detailing design requirements that will allow them to reinitiate development of its cardiovascular drug Contrave. Shares +100% prior to trading halt, will resume trading at 4:30 pm EST.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • EHC

    HealthSouth (HLS) changes the time for tomorrow's conference call up to 8:30 AM from 4:30 PM...

    HealthSouth (HLS) changes the time for tomorrow's conference call up to 8:30 AM from 4:30 PM after its shares fell off 8%. An analyst with Capital Group says Obama's budget plan for inpatient rehab facilities represent a "poisonous combination," while Susquehanna sees a $115M-$120M revenue headwind for HealthSouth if the proposals go forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL): FQ1 EPS of $0.48 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $8.4B (+10.7% Y/Y) in-line....

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL): FQ1 EPS of $0.48 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $8.4B (+10.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +0.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • TPX

    Tempur-Pedic International (TPX -2.8%) is lower going into the close after Goldman initiates the...

    Tempur-Pedic International (TPX -2.8%) is lower going into the close after Goldman initiates the shares with a tepid neutral. Goldman says the company is at a relatively mature point in its growth cycle, suggesting we should wait for a more favorable risk/reward metric to take advantage of the long-term positives.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • IPG

    Interpublic Group (IPG +8.2%) surges to the top of the S&P leader board, and no one seems...

    Interpublic Group (IPG +8.2%) surges to the top of the S&P leader board, and no one seems quite sure why. Interpublic shares had been beaten down by nearly a quarter over the summer, including a 5.6% drubbing Monday, and SmarTrend notes that "often times after large one-day declines, short-term traders may play for some degree of mean reversion."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • FCX

    Copper prices continue their plunge today, -2% to $3.70/lb, taking shares of copper companies...

    Copper prices continue their plunge today, -2% to $3.70/lb, taking shares of copper companies with them: Freeport McMorRan Copper & Gold (FCX -4.5%), Southern Copper (SCCO -3.5%), Rio Tinto (RIO -0.6%), BHP Billiton (BHP -0.6%), Augusta Resources (AZC -5.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • CELG

    Celgene (CELG +6.9%) shares rise on speculation that a positive resolution of a European...

    Celgene (CELG +6.9%) shares rise on speculation that a positive resolution of a European regulatory review of its Revlimid cancer drug could be imminent. Analysts say the EU advisory panel meeting this week may support the drug's overall risk/benefit ratio after clinical data suggested increased risk of secondary malignancies in long-term users.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • CWTR

    Coldwater Creek (CWTR +8.5%) pops on reports Co-founder and CEO Dennis Pence has now invested...

    Coldwater Creek (CWTR +8.5%) pops on reports Co-founder and CEO Dennis Pence has now invested upwards of $1.4M into shares of the struggling retailer over the past two weeks as the stock hits all time lows.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • TEVA

    Teva (TEVA -2.8%) dips after Baxter (BAX +1.9%) wins a bid to force the company to pay all costs...

    Teva (TEVA -2.8%) dips after Baxter (BAX +1.9%) wins a bid to force the company to pay all costs relating to claims that tainted vials of propofol caused colonoscopy patients to develop hepatitis.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • CF

    Fertilizer stocks sink in unison today after M&A chatter that has ramped up interest in...

    Fertilizer stocks sink in unison today after M&A chatter that has ramped up interest in shares starts to subside. Decliners: CF -5.8%, TNH -5.7%, POT -3.5%, MOS -2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • TLB

    Insider buying is giving hard-luck women's clothing retailer Talbots (TLB +4.3%) a lift....

    Insider buying is giving hard-luck women's clothing retailer Talbots (TLB +4.3%) a lift. StreetInsider.com reports CEO Trudy F. Sullivan bought 12K shares, and CFO/COO Michael Scarpa bought 10K. Talbots has long been the subject of takeover speculation.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • GOLD

    Jim Cramer gives a boost to gold shares today after commenting late Monday on CNBC's "Mad Money"...

    Jim Cramer gives a boost to gold shares today after commenting late Monday on CNBC's "Mad Money" that gold companies used to pay some of the highest dividends, and could do so again: Randgold Resources (GOLD +3.5%), Goldcorp (GG +4%), Barick Gold (ABX +1.4%) and Newmont Mining (NEM +5.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • VDSI-OLD

    VASCO Data Security International (VDSI-OLD -3.9%) gets hit after saying one of its European...

    VASCO Data Security International (VDSI-OLD -3.9%) gets hit after saying one of its European subsidiaries, DigiNotar B.V., filed a voluntary bankruptcy petition in the Netherlands on Monday, and was declared bankrupt today.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • FINL

    Athletic-apparel retailer Finish Line (FINL -3.1%) takes a hit after WJB Capital cut the shares...

    Athletic-apparel retailer Finish Line (FINL -3.1%) takes a hit after WJB Capital cut the shares to hold ahead of Thursday's Q2 earnings report. The firm cites concern over a loss of sales due to the NBA lockout, and that back-to-school sales may have been more sluggish than reported.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • V

    Visa (V +3.6%) trades higher after saying late yesterday it had signed a licensing deal to...

    Visa (V +3.6%) trades higher after saying late yesterday it had signed a licensing deal to include its credit and debit cards in Google's (GOOG +1.5%) mobile wallet application.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • GURE

    Gulf Resources (GURE +13%) pops after saying it's submitted an 8-K filing that verifies three...

    Gulf Resources (GURE +13%) pops after saying it's submitted an 8-K filing that verifies three local government agencies have validated the company's market leadership, number of facilities and 2010 production volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • PLXS

    Plexus (PLXS -5%) shares fall after Ticonderoga cuts it to sell on valuation. Ticonderoga says...

    Plexus (PLXS -5%) shares fall after Ticonderoga cuts it to sell on valuation. Ticonderoga says its peers have a more attractive relative value, and disappointing earnings and weakness among its networking customers only exacerbates earnings risk.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • CMLS

    It's a banner week for microcap Cumulus Media (NASDAQ:CMLS) after CRT Capital initiates coverage...

    It's a banner week for microcap Cumulus Media (NASDAQ:CMLS) after CRT Capital initiates coverage with a Buy rating and the WSJ mentions the company in relation to its entry into the daily deals business as a competitor to Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) and Yelp. Shares are up 20% on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • ATRN

    Microcap Atrinsic (ATRN +41.3%) soars after saying Kazaa, its streaming music app, is now...

    Microcap Atrinsic (ATRN +41.3%) soars after saying Kazaa, its streaming music app, is now available for download through Apple's (AAPL +2.31%) App Store.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • WEN

    Investors seem to love Dave's Hot 'n Juicy, Wendy's (WEN +5.1%) new burger offering, as much as...

    Investors seem to love Dave's Hot 'n Juicy, Wendy's (WEN +5.1%) new burger offering, as much as customers, as shares surge within 10% of 52-week highs. This isn't the New Coke (NYSE:KO), Barclays believes; Wendy's was a tired brand, but Barclays sees a turnaround after the new brand is firmly set and updates are fully integrated.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • HL

    Hecla Mining (HL +3.1%) trades higher after it adopts a stock dividend policy that links...

    Hecla Mining (HL +3.1%) trades higher after it adopts a stock dividend policy that links payments to the average quarterly realized silver price of the preceding quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • AAL

    Airline stocks are higher today, after the International Air Transport Association raises its...

    Airline stocks are higher today, after the International Air Transport Association raises its 2011 industry profit outlook: AMR (AMR +5.2%), US Airways (LCC +4%) Southwest Airlines (LUV +0.3%), United Continental (UAL +0.5%), Ryanair (RYAAY +0.7%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • DISH

    Dish Network's (DISH +4%) Blockbuster unit is expected to announce Friday a video streaming...

    Dish Network's (DISH +4%) Blockbuster unit is expected to announce Friday a video streaming service to compete with Netflix (NFLX -8.5%). Netflix shares are off 36% in 4 days, with a longer-term chart resembling that of a broken bubble.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • KONA

    Kona Grill (KONA +27%) continues to soar on heavy volume after the company boosted guidance late...

    Kona Grill (KONA +27%) continues to soar on heavy volume after the company boosted guidance late yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • KITD

    KIT digital (OTC:KITD +4.2%) trades higher today, absent an overhang, after the company closes...

    KIT digital (OTC:KITD +4.2%) trades higher today, absent an overhang, after the company closes its previously announced secondary offering of 3.2M shares with strong demand at $9.50 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • XLNX

    Xilinx (XLNX -2.5%) is selling off following this morning's guidance cut, and a downgrade from...

    Xilinx (XLNX -2.5%) is selling off following this morning's guidance cut, and a downgrade from Auriga to Hold could be playing a role. Auriga is positive on the chipmaker's 28nm products, but expects it to be hurt by macro trends, customer inventory corrections, low Chinese exposure, and market share losses to Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • BB

    RBC Capital’s Mike Abramsky reiterates a Sector Perform rating on Research in Motion (RIMM...

    RBC Capital’s Mike Abramsky reiterates a Sector Perform rating on Research in Motion (RIMM -1.6%), but his analysis sounds more like a downgrade. Four years after iPhone's (NASDAQ:AAPL) launch, he says RIM "still hasn’t launched competitive smartphone innovations or addressed its ‘app gap,’" and it has a “credibility gap” with investors because of poor guidance in past reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • JKS

    Solar stocks aren't joining in on today's rally, as leading names continue moving lower...

    Solar stocks aren't joining in on today's rally, as leading names continue moving lower following yesterday's news of a toxic chemical leak at a JinkoSolar (JKS -4.6%) plant. TSL -7.5%. CSIQ -5.4%. FSLR -3.1%. YGE -5.3%. STP -6.2%. SOL -6.4%. GTAT -5.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 9 Comments
  • HSBC

    National Bank of Canada agrees to acquire HSBC's (HBC +1.4%) Canadian retail brokerage unit for...

    National Bank of Canada agrees to acquire HSBC's (HBC +1.4%) Canadian retail brokerage unit for $208.1M, according to the Wall Street Journal. The deal is expected to be announced later today.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • ONXX

    Jefferies follows Goldman's lead last week and initiates Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +2.7%) with...

    Jefferies follows Goldman's lead last week and initiates Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +2.7%) with a buy on valuation, but puts a slightly higher price target on the shares at $44.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • NEM

    Gold stocks are gaining today, as the metal rises to $1,806/oz. and execs make positive remarks...

    Gold stocks are gaining today, as the metal rises to $1,806/oz. and execs make positive remarks at the Denver Gold Forum. NEM +5.3%. GG +3.8%. GFI +2.8%. AUY +3.7%. ABX +2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • CCL

    Shares of Carnival (CCL +5.5%) show a steady gain after beating earnings estimates, brushing off...

    Shares of Carnival (CCL +5.5%) show a steady gain after beating earnings estimates, brushing off talk of an industry slowdown. Rival Royal Caribbean Cruises (NYSE:RCL) is also enjoying the euphoria with shares up 6.3% on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies Group (JEF +3.6%) announces a new 20M share repurchase program. This comes on the back...

    Jefferies Group (JEF +3.6%) announces a new 20M share repurchase program. This comes on the back of its existing buyback program, of which it had approximately 6.7M shares remaining.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • LYV

    Live Nation Entertainment (LYV +1.4%) says it will partner with Vivendi SA's (VIVHY.PK +1.2%)...

    Live Nation Entertainment (LYV +1.4%) says it will partner with Vivendi SA's (VIVHY.PK +1.2%) Universal Music Group to promote the recording company's artists in a cross-marketing effort to boost profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • GM

    General Motors (GM -1.1%) doesn't get much of a breather after finalizing a deal with the UAW...

    General Motors (GM -1.1%) doesn't get much of a breather after finalizing a deal with the UAW after analysts dive in to assess the impact of the new contract on GM's earnings and share price. UBS takes a whack today, trimming its price target estimate to $31 from $42 to go along with a Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies Group (JEF +3.8%) retraces yesterday's loss as Q3 earnings fall 49% but beat...

    Jefferies Group (JEF +3.8%) retraces yesterday's loss as Q3 earnings fall 49% but beat expectations. The company is attempting to set itself up for future strong growth by hiring in a weak trading environment and while its competitors are cutting staff.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • APA

    Deutsche initiates coverage of the drillers, saying liquids production growth will be a dominant...

    Deutsche initiates coverage of the drillers, saying liquids production growth will be a dominant driver over the next year. The following are started with a buy: Apache (APA +0.8%), Anadarko Petroleum (APC +2.1%), Noble Energy (NBL +3.6%), Newfield Exploration (NFX +1.5%), Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +1.3%), Cimarex Energy (XEC +0.8%), Oasis Petroleum (OAS +1.7%), Concho Resources (CXO +2.1%), and SM Energy (SM +1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • REXX

    Rex Energy (REXX +10.9%) pops after Brean Murray upgrades shares to Buy from Hold and sets a...

    Rex Energy (REXX +10.9%) pops after Brean Murray upgrades shares to Buy from Hold and sets a price target of $26, repping 73% upside potential. An analyst with the firm dug into the oil company's production report to find higher well reserves than anticipated. Shares blew past a 52-week high in intraday trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • MGM

    MGM gains 5.2% after Morgan Stanley's Mark Strawn upgrades the casino owner to Overweight. While...

    MGM gains 5.2% after Morgan Stanley's Mark Strawn upgrades the casino owner to Overweight. While acknowledging macro and debt concerns, Strawn sees MGM offering a "compelling risk/reward" at current levels, and believes fears about the company's liquidity are overblown. He also expects MGM's Las Vegas operations to rebound. (previously)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • KR

    Grocers Kroger (KR -0.5%), Safeway (SWY -0.4%) and SuperValue (SVU +0.5%) reach an agreement...

    Grocers Kroger (KR -0.5%), Safeway (SWY -0.4%) and SuperValue (SVU +0.5%) reach an agreement with Southern California workers, avoiding a potentially costly strike in an area considered a "trend-setter" for the rest of the country. "The agreement increases wages, protects health care and pension benefits throughout the life of the three-year contract," says a union rep.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • HME

    Home Properties (HME -5.6%) trades lower after it prices its 5.25M share secondary offering at...

    Home Properties (HME -5.6%) trades lower after it prices its 5.25M share secondary offering at $58.5 per share. The company plans to use the proceeds to fund acquisitions, new development and redevelopment of its apartment communities.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +3.2%) trades higher this morning after being initiated with a...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +3.2%) trades higher this morning after being initiated with a buy at Jefferies with a $36 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • FDS

    Shares of FactSet Research Systems (FDS +3.3%) gain after the company knocks out an earnings...

    Shares of FactSet Research Systems (FDS +3.3%) gain after the company knocks out an earnings beat of a penny for Q4 on revenue of $192M (+14% Y/Y). Professionals using FactSet's trading software increased by 5% to 48K over the last three months.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • MCPIQ

    More on the Molycorp (MCP -15%) downgrade: Longtime bull Mike Gambardella "(takes) a more...

    More on the Molycorp (MCP -15%) downgrade: Longtime bull Mike Gambardella "(takes) a more cautious stance on the stock," noting the recent decline in rare earth prices and a sharp cut in forecast world demand. However, he still sees China taking steps to reduce supply and restrict production over time.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • MCO

    Moody's (NYSE:MCO) now knows what it's like to take an analyst downgrade square in the face...

    Moody's (NYSE:MCO) now knows what it's like to take an analyst downgrade square in the face after Benchmark lowered its rating on shares to Hold from Buy and set a lower price target of $29 - citing a turbulent market environment. Shares are down 2.5% in early trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • EHC

    Shares of HealthSouth (HLS -17.4%) crater after the firm announces it will host a conference...

    Shares of HealthSouth (HLS -17.4%) crater after the firm announces it will host a conference call tomorrow after the market closes to discuss the impact of President Obama's deficit reduction plan on the firm's rehab facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • CARB

    Carbonite (NASDAQ:CARB) moves 5.5% higher after Oppenheimer initiates coverage with an...

    Carbonite (NASDAQ:CARB) moves 5.5% higher after Oppenheimer initiates coverage with an Outperform rating and a $17 price target, saying the cloud-based backup company is well-positioned in a growing market. Today marks the end of Carbonite's quiet period.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • SVM

    Just 2 weeks ago, long Silvercorp (SVM -1.3%) and defending the company against fraud...

    Just 2 weeks ago, long Silvercorp (SVM -1.3%) and defending the company against fraud accusations, Adam Gefvert reverses as new information emerges. While he doesn't believe the firm is completely illegitimate, he calls for SVM to hire an outside geology firm to confirm the "grams/ton," or purity of its SGX mine.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • LOGI

    Logitech (NASDAQ:LOGI) drops 3.9% after Goldman's Simon Schafer downgrades the PC peripherals...

    Logitech (NASDAQ:LOGI) drops 3.9% after Goldman's Simon Schafer downgrades the PC peripherals and electronics gear vendor to Sell, believing a weak consumer spending environment will hurt sales. Schafer thinks Logitech's FY12 forecast is too optimistic, and is also worried about challenges related to its CEO transition.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) shares continue their descent, -4.2% in addition to yesterday's 7.4%...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) shares continue their descent, -4.2% in addition to yesterday's 7.4% shellacking after its "panic move" in splitting its DVD and streaming businesses. Morningstar says the July price increase was "necessary to help Netflix invest more in the streaming business, but it was a mistake to not offer a discounted price to customers taking both DVDs and streaming."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • PHM

    Embattled PulteGroup (NYSE:PHM) catches an upgrade from UBS to Buy from Neutral on valuation...

    Embattled PulteGroup (NYSE:PHM) catches an upgrade from UBS to Buy from Neutral on valuation with a $8 price target - repping a healthy 83% upside potential. Shares of the home builder are up 5.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • PHM

    Premarket gainers: PHM +5%. MGM +4%. LVLT +4%. RCL +4%. ALU +3%.Losers: NCT -10%. MCP -6%. HME...

    Premarket gainers: PHM +5%. MGM +4%. LVLT +4%. RCL +4%. ALU +3%.
    Losers: NCT -10%. MCP -6%. HME -5%. WES -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • RCL

    Royal Caribbean Cruises (NYSE:RCL) is up 3.8% premarket, recapturing yesterday's loss in share...

    Royal Caribbean Cruises (NYSE:RCL) is up 3.8% premarket, recapturing yesterday's loss in share value after Raymond James came down hard with its outlook on the industry. The WSJ isn't bullish either, saying a "middle-class malaise" will continue to hurt cruise operators like RCL and Carnival (NYSE:CCL).

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • XLNX

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX) warns its FQ2 sales will decline 7-10% Q/Q, compared with prior guidance...

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX) warns its FQ2 sales will decline 7-10% Q/Q, compared with prior guidance for -3% to +1% growth. Though this expected decline is worse than the one forecast by rival Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR), investors only appear slightly bothered by it: Xilinx is down just 0.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM

  • The dollar and the euro momentarily soar against the Swiss franc as a rumor makes the rounds...

    The dollar and the euro momentarily soar against the Swiss franc as a rumor makes the rounds that the SNB is going to raise the floor on the euro/franc rate to CHF 1.25 from CHF 1.20. Earlier news that Swiss exports plunged in August make this morning a convenient time for such chatter.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • CEA

    Chinese airline stocks are taking it on the chin in premarket action even as domestic carriers...

    Chinese airline stocks are taking it on the chin in premarket action even as domestic carriers look to keep up with competitors that are adding flights into Asian markets. China Eastern Airlines (NYSE:CEA) is down 4.4% and China Southern Airlines (NYSE:ZNH) is off 5.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • AET

    Coventry Health Care (CVH) is down 1.5% premarket after Wedbush downgrades the insurance...

    Coventry Health Care (CVH) is down 1.5% premarket after Wedbush downgrades the insurance provider to Underperform. The firm believes industry pricing may be entering a down cycle, and if this happens, Coventry faces more margin compression risk than rivals UNH and WLP. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • TRV

    Shares of Travelers (NYSE:TRV) tack on 2% premarket after Goldman Sachs does an about-face and...

    Shares of Travelers (NYSE:TRV) tack on 2% premarket after Goldman Sachs does an about-face and switches its rating to Buy from Sell with a lofty price target of $63.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • MGM

    MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) gains 3.5% premarket after grabbing an upgrade from Morgan Stanley to...

    MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) gains 3.5% premarket after grabbing an upgrade from Morgan Stanley to Overweight. Shares have been on a bit of a run over the last month, adding a tidy 15% gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • AWCMF

    Shares of Alumina Limited (AWC) fall 3.7% premarket after industry sources say China may keep...

    Shares of Alumina Limited (AWC) fall 3.7% premarket after industry sources say China may keep imports of raw material alumina capped as domestic production increases.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • MCPIQ

    JPMorgan downgrades Molycorp (MCP), cutting its price target to $66 from $105. The bank had...

    JPMorgan downgrades Molycorp (MCP), cutting its price target to $66 from $105. The bank had previously been a big bull on the stock. Shares -4.5% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:33 AM | 1 Comment
